actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-115, by Mr. Derrick.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2696. The resolution waives certain points of order against consideration of H.R. 2696. Measure will be read by section. Specified amendments are in order. It shall be in order to consider the following amendments printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution: (1) the amendment, if offered, by Representative Mrazek; (2) the amendment, if offered, by Representative Owens of Utah; (3) the amendment, if offered, by Representative Martin of Illinois; and (4), the amendments, if offered, by Representative Roe of New Jersey or his designee and said amendments may be considered en bloc and shall not be subject to a demand for a division of the question in the House or in the Committee of the Whole.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 29.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 364 - 47 (Roll no. 114).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order against consideration of the bill (H.R. 2696) making appropriations for energy and water development for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1990, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 2696 (energy and water development funding).

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order against consideration of the bill (H.R. 2696) making appropriations for energy and water development for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1990, and for other purposes.
